content.text:
- **Title:** Discovery of novel imidazo[1,2-b]pyridazine derivatives as potent covalent inhibitors of CDK12/13 — PubMed  
  - **URL:** `https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/39955845/`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “compound 24 emerged as the most potent inhibitor, with CDK12 IC_{50} of 15.5 nM and CDK13 IC_{50} of 12.2 nM.” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/39955845/))  
    - “effectively suppresses the proliferation of TNBC cell lines MDA-MB-231 and MDA-MB-468” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/39955845/))  
    - “CDK12/13 covalent inhibitor, THZ531.” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/39955845/))  

- **Title:** Noncovalent CDK12/13 dual inhibitors-based PROTACs degrade CDK12-Cyclin K complex and induce synthetic lethality with PARP inhibitor — PubMed  
  - **URL:** `https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34864331/`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “a potent PROTAC degrader PP-C8 based on the noncovalent dual inhibitors of CDK12/13” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34864331/))  
    - “PP-C8 demonstrates profound synergistic antiproliferative effects with PARP inhibitor in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34864331/))  
    - “Keywords:  CDK12; Cyclin K; PROTAC; Synthetic lethality; Triple-negative breast cancer.” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34864331/))  

- **Title:** Discovery of a Highly Potent and Selective Dual PROTAC Degrader of CDK12 and CDK13 — PubMed  
  - **URL:** `https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35938508/`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “(CDK12/13) presents a novel therapeutic opportunity for triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC)” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35938508/))  
    - “The optimal compound 7f effectively degraded CDK12 and CDK13 with DC_{50} values of 2.2 and 2.1 nM” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35938508/))  
    - “multiple TNBC cell lines including MFM223, with an IC_{50} value of 47 nM.” ([pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35938508/))  

- **Title:** SR-4835 | CDK12/13 inhibitor | Axon 3184 — Axon Medchem  
  - **URL:** `https://www.axonmedchem.com/product/3184`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “CAS:  2387704-62-1” ([axonmedchem.com](https://www.axonmedchem.com/product/3184))  
    - “SR-4835 is a potent, highly selective and orally bioavailable dual inhibitor of CDK12 and CDK13” ([axonmedchem.com](https://www.axonmedchem.com/product/3184))  
    - “anti-triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) activity” ([axonmedchem.com](https://www.axonmedchem.com/product/3184))  

- **Title:** THZ531 | CDK12/13 inhibitor | Axon 3402 — Axon Medchem  
  - **URL:** `https://www.axonmedchem.com/3402-thz531`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “CAS:  1702809-17-3” ([axonmedchem.com](https://www.axonmedchem.com/3402-thz531))  
    - “THZ531 is a first-in-class, potent, selective, covalent inhibitor of CDK12 and CDK13” ([axonmedchem.com](https://www.axonmedchem.com/3402-thz531))  

- **Title:** PP-C8|Cas# — GlpBio  
  - **URL:** `https://www.glpbio.com/pp-c8.html`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “Catalog No.GC69730” ([glpbio.com](https://www.glpbio.com/pp-c8.html))  
    - “PP-C8 is an effective selective PROTAC CDK12-Cyclin K degrader.” ([glpbio.com](https://www.glpbio.com/pp-c8.html))  
    - “triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC)” ([glpbio.com](https://www.glpbio.com/pp-c8.html))  

- **Title:** Carrick Therapeutics Announces First Patient Dosed in Phase 1 Clinical Trial of CT7439 (CDK12/13 Inhibitor) — Carrick Therapeutics  
  - **URL:** `https://www.carricktherapeutics.com/news-media/press-releases/detail/25/carrick-therapeutics-announces-first-patient-dosed-in-phase`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “CT7439, a novel cyclin dependent kinase 12/13 (CDK12/13) inhibitor / Cyclin-K glue-degrader.” ([carricktherapeutics.com](https://www.carricktherapeutics.com/news-media/press-releases/detail/25/carrick-therapeutics-announces-first-patient-dosed-in-phase))  
    - “study ID: NCT06600789.” ([carricktherapeutics.com](https://www.carricktherapeutics.com/news-media/press-releases/detail/25/carrick-therapeutics-announces-first-patient-dosed-in-phase))  
    - “CT7439 is an inhibitor of CDK12/13 as well as a 'glue degrader' of Cyclin-K” ([carricktherapeutics.com](https://www.carricktherapeutics.com/news-media/press-releases/detail/25/carrick-therapeutics-announces-first-patient-dosed-in-phase))  

- **Title:** Clinical Trial NCT06600789 — ICH GCP (Clinical Trials Registry)  
  - **URL:** `https://ichgcp.net/clinical-trials-registry/NCT06600789`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “Clinical Trial NCT06600789” ([ichgcp.net](https://ichgcp.net/clinical-trials-registry/NCT06600789))  
    - “Drug: CT7439 Capsules (0.5 mg, 1mg, 3mg)” ([ichgcp.net](https://ichgcp.net/clinical-trials-registry/NCT06600789))  
    - “Phase 1/2, FIH study” ([ichgcp.net](https://ichgcp.net/clinical-trials-registry/NCT06600789))  

- **Title:** WO2021249517A1 — A molecular glue regulating cdk12-ddb1 interaction to trigger cyclin k degradation — Google Patents  
  - **URL:** `https://patents.google.com/patent/WO2021249517A1/en`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “PCT/CN2021/099517 2020-06-10 2021-06-10 A molecular glue regulating cdk12-ddb1 interaction to trigger cyclin k degradation  Ceased  WO2021249517A1 ( en )” ([patents.google.com](https://patents.google.com/patent/WO2021249517A1/en))  
    - “THZ531 inhibited glue01-dependent formation of the CDK12KD/CCNK ⁇ C/DDB1 complex.” ([patents.google.com](https://patents.google.com/patent/WO2021249517A1/en))  
    - “Example 9 Glue01-dependent degradation of CCNK causes decreased NRF transcription and cell death” ([patents.google.com](https://patents.google.com/patent/WO2021249517A1/en))  

- **Title:** Discovery of a molecular glue promoting CDK12-DDB1 interaction to trigger cyclin K degradation — DOAJ (eLife)  
  - **URL:** `https://doaj.org/article/2516480b8dea4d3f9002f19ca4784d02`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “a new molecular glue HQ461 discovered by high-throughput screening.” ([doaj.org](https://doaj.org/article/2516480b8dea4d3f9002f19ca4784d02))  
    - “HQ461 acts by promoting an interaction between CDK12 and DDB1-CUL4-RBX1 E3 ubiquitin ligase” ([doaj.org](https://doaj.org/article/2516480b8dea4d3f9002f19ca4784d02))  
    - “Cyclin K (CCNK)” ([doaj.org](https://doaj.org/article/2516480b8dea4d3f9002f19ca4784d02))  

- **Title:** Discovery and design of molecular glue enhancers of CDK12–DDB1 interactions for targeted degradation of cyclin K — RSC Chemical Biology  
  - **URL:** `https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlehtml/2025/cb/d4cb00190g`  
  - **Direct quotes:**  
    - “dinaciclib, to generate compound MR-1226” ([pubs.rsc.org](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlehtml/2025/cb/d4cb00190g))  
    - “MR-1226 effectively degraded cyclin K with a DC _{50} of 50 nM” ([pubs.rsc.org](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlehtml/2025/cb/d4cb00190g))  
    - “SR-4835 effectively degraded cyclin K (D _{max} > 95%) with a DC _{50} of approximately 90 nM” ([pubs.rsc.org](https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlehtml/2025/cb/d4cb00190g))
